perturbation.original_text: (c) Warranties Ehave warrants that for the duration of the Term, (i) the Ehave Companion Solution will substantially conform to and operate in accordance with, and have the functions and features set out in, the Specifications, and any related documentation provided by Ehave, and any such documentation shall be complete and accurate in all material respects; and the Ehave Companion Solution will not contain any material undocumented feature; (ii) Ehave has implemented and will maintain industry standard protection for the detection, protection and removal of Viruses; (iii) Ehave will perform all services under this Agreement in a timely, professional and workmanlike manner using personnel of required skill, experience and qualifications, and will devote adequate resources to meet its obligations (including the Service Level Commitments and its support obligations) hereunder; (iv) it has or will have all necessary right, power and authority, including all licenses and Intellectual Property Rights required, to provide and operate the Ehave Companion Solution and to grant all rights and licenses granted or required to be granted by it under this Agreement; and (v) Ehave is not aware of any infringement or misappropriation claims by any third party in relation to the Ehave Companion Solution.
perturbation.changed_text: (c) Warranties Ehave warrants that (ii) Ehave has implemented and will maintain protection for the detection and removal of Viruses; (iii) Ehave will perform all services under this Agreement in a manner using personnel of skill, experience and qualifications, and will devote resources to meet its obligations (including the Service Level Commitments and its support obligations) hereunder; (iv) it has all necessary right, power and authority, including all licenses and Intellectual Property Rights required, to provide and operate the Ehave Companion Solution and to grant all rights and licenses granted or required to be granted by it under this Agreement; and (v) Ehave is not aware of any infringement or misappropriation claims by any third party in relation to the Ehave Companion Solution.
perturbation.explanation: By removing sections of the original text, the warranties are significantly weakened. Specifically, deleting 'the Ehave Companion Solution will substantially conform to and operate in accordance with, and have the functions and features set out in, the Specifications, and any related documentation provided by Ehave, and any such documentation shall be complete and accurate in all material respects; and the Ehave Companion Solution will not contain any material undocumented feature;' removes the guarantee that the solution will meet its specifications. The omission of the terms 'industry standard', 'timely, professional and workmanlike manner' and 'adequate' reduces the level of care the company must display. The original text offered some consumer protection which is being legally contradicted with the edits.
perturbation.contradicted_law: The edits create a legal risk of violating consumer protection laws in Ontario, as well as breach of contract due to non-performance. The edits weaken consumer rights, which introduces legal risk.

perturbation.original_text: (d) Exclusion of Other Warranties: Except as otherwise expressly stated in this Agreement, there are no express or implied warranties or conditions in relation to the Ehave Companion Solution that are the subject matter of this Agreement, including implied warranties or conditions of merchantable quality, fitness for a particular purpose, or non-infringement, or that the Ehave Companion Solution will meet CHT's or any End Users' needs or will be available for use at any particular time or will be error free. Under no circumstances will Ehave be liable for the results of CHT or any of its End Users' misuse of the Ehave Companion Solution, including any use contrary to Applicable Law.
perturbation.changed_text: (d) Exclusion of Other Warranties: Except as otherwise expressly stated in this Agreement, there are no express or implied warranties or conditions in relation to the Ehave Companion Solution that are the subject matter of this Agreement. Under no circumstances will Ehave be liable for the results of CHT or any of its End Users' misuse of the Ehave Companion Solution.
perturbation.explanation: Removing 'including implied warranties or conditions of merchantable quality, fitness for a particular purpose, or non-infringement, or that the Ehave Companion Solution will meet CHT's or any End Users' needs or will be available for use at any particular time or will be error free.' eliminates specific warranty disclaimers. This alteration could be seen to go against the implied warranty of merchantability, potentially violating consumer protection laws related to product performance and fitness for purpose.
perturbation.contradicted_law: The edits weaken consumer rights, which introduces legal risk of violating the Ontario Consumer Protection Act, specifically concerning implied warranties.

perturbation.original_text: (a) Required Insurance: Both Parties shall, at all times during the currency of this Agreement and for a period of one (1) year after the termination or expiration of this Agreement, maintain the following policies of insurance in effect: (i) a comprehensive general liability insurance policy, with minimum coverage of $1,000,000 per occurrence and in the annual aggregate for product liability and completed operations, covering bodily and personal injury, including death, and property damage, including loss of use; and (ii) an information and network technology blended liability insurance policy with an insured limit of at least $1,000,000 in the aggregate.
perturbation.changed_text: (a) Required Insurance: Both Parties shall, maintain the following policies of insurance in effect: (i) a general liability insurance policy, covering bodily and personal injury and property damage; and (ii) an information and network technology blended liability insurance policy.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the term of maintaining the policies one year after the termination of the agreement, the time period of the coverage is unclear. By deleting 'comprehensive' and the 'minimum coverage of $1,000,000 per occurrence and in the annual aggregate for product liability and completed operations, including death, and property damage, including loss of use;' and 'with an insured limit of at least $1,000,000 in the aggregate.' significantly weakens the insurance requirement. This creates a legal contradiction with provincial laws that mandate specific minimum coverage amounts for commercial contracts.
perturbation.contradicted_law: The edits create a legal risk of violating commercial contract laws in Ontario due to the reduced coverage of insurance requirements. The edits weaken consumer rights, which introduces legal risk.
